009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.threshold.Thresholder;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Common interface to be implemented by all adaptive (i.e., non-global)
018 * thresholders. See Sec. 9.2 of [1] for an overview.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
022 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/08/01
027 */
028public interface AdaptiveThresholder extends Thresholder {
029        
030        /**
031         * Calculates a adaptive "threshold surface" for the specified
032         * {@link ByteProcessor} and returns it as another {@link ByteProcessor}.
033         * 
034         * @param bp the input image
035         * @return the threshold surface
036         */
037        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor bp);
038        
039        /**
040         * Thresholds a  {@link ByteProcessor} image by the specified
041         * threshold surface.
042         * 
043         * @param bp the input image (gets modified)
044         * @param Q the threshold surface
045         */
046        public default void threshold(ByteProcessor bp, ByteProcessor Q) {
047                final int w = bp.getWidth();
048                final int h = bp.getHeight();
049                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
050                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
051                                int p = bp.get(u, v);
052                                int q = Q.get(u, v);
053                                bp.set(u, v, (p <= q) ? 0 : 255);
054                        }
055                }
056        }
057        
058        @Override
059        public default boolean threshold(ByteProcessor ip) {
060                ByteProcessor Q = this.getThreshold(ip);
061                if (Q != null) {
062                        this.threshold(ip, Q);
063                        return true;
064                }
065                else {
066                        return false;
067                }
068        }
069
070}
